gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਥਮ ਹੀ ਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਹਾਨਿ ਕੈ ਪਤੰਗ ਬਿਧਿ ਪਾਛੈ ਕੈ ਅਨੂਪ ਰੂਪ ਦੀਪਕ ਦਿਖਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Pradam Hee Aan Dhiaan Haani Kai Patang Bidhi , Paachhai Kai Anoop Roop Deepak Dikhaaay Hai ?
translation: Like a moth, an obedient human being of the Guru regards all other concentrations of mind as loss incurring proposition and then, like seeing the light of the lamp (by the moth), he sees the beautiful sight of the True Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਥਮ ਹੀ ਅਾਨ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਬਿਸਰਜਿ ਕੈ ਅਨਹਦ ਨਾਦ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਸੁਨਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Pradam Hee Aan Giaan Surati Bisaraji Kai , Anahad Naad Mrig Jougati Sounaaay Hai ?
translation: Just as a deer discards all other sounds in favour of the melody of Chanda Herha, a disciple of the Guru listens to the sound of unstruck music after obtaining and practicing on Guru's teachings and words.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਥਮ ਹੀ ਬਚਨ ਰਚਨ ਹਰਿ ਗੁੰਗ ਸਾਜਿ ਪਾਛੈ ਕੈ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਰਸ ਅਪਿਓ ਪੀਅਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Pradam Hee Bachan Rachan Hari Goung Saaji , Paachhai Kai Anmrit Ras Apiao Peeaaay Hai ?
translation: Like a black bee, giving up its noisy stance and engulfing itself in the fragrance of the lotus-like feet of the Guru, he drinks deep the wondrous elixir of the Naam.

gurmukhi: ਪੇਖ ਸੁਨ ਅਚਵਤ ਹੀ ਭੲੇ ਬਿਸਮ ਅਤਿ ਪਰਮਦਭੁਤ ਅਸਚਰਜ ਸਮਾੲੇ ਹੈ ||੪੩੨||
transliteration: Paykh Soun Achavat Hee Bhaay Bisam Ati , Paramadabhout Asacharaj Samaaay Hai ?432?
translation: And thus a devoted Sikh of the Guru, seeing the vision of his Guru, hearing the sweet sound of Guru's words and relishing the Naam Amrit (elixir-like name of the Lord) reaches a high state of bliss and merges in the astonishing and supremely strange God.
